bug.short_desc: Make sure the changed UA strings are working

long_desc.thetext:
Mozilla and webkit plan to change their user agent strings. We need to check that the environment checks can handle these strings the right way.
Here are some links: http://www.webkit.org/blog/1580/user-agent-string-changes-on-webkit-trunk/ http://blog.chromium.org/2011/03/ua-string-changes-coming-in-chrome-11.html

Microsoft is also planing to change their UA string for IE 10:
http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ie/archive/2011/04/15/the-ie10-user-agent-string.aspx

Checked the current implementation with the given user agens in the links:
Chrome Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/534.24 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/11.0.696.16 Safari/534.24
Webkit Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; WOW64) AppleWebKit/534.27+ (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/5.0.4 Safari/533.20.27
IE Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 10.0; Windows NT 6.1; Trident/6.0)
Everything works as expected.
